verbs.description: artist tyrus wong legacy soars over generations [ARG0: kim] [V: brings] [ARGM-DIR: out] [ARG1: a tall stack of green cloth circles topped by a head with independently spinning eyes documentarian pamela tom] says one of the quotes in my film says he one of the best - known asian american artists and at the same time one of the least known looking over footage in an editing bay in los angeles atwater village neighborhood she says in certain communities he is a living legend wong was one of the first chinese american artists to have an effect on mainstream american culture emerging in the 30s in a climate of harsh racial prejudice later when he was able to visit china his mother was gone by then but the house where he had lived had been preserved and the picture of our family was still hung on the wall detained alone as childbecause of immigration laws that worked against chinese families the just - arrived 9-year - old wong was separated from his father for a month and detained alone on angel island money was so tight that as young tyrus artistic skills began to emerge father and son sometimes could not afford ink even when he was getting trained in the western perspective at otis he was going to the l a public library and looking at books on the sung dynasty his decision to take work at disney as an in - betweener one of the artists charged with drawing the many marginally differing frames conveying movement in the early days of animation wong gorgeous eastern - inflected paintings shaped the film lush visual world wong has worked in ceramics made toys for his children and two grandchildren and since his retirement about 45 years ago fashioned the exotic kites that paint the santa monica beach sky once a month healthwise his daughter says he doing great despite hospital visits this year for an ulcer and pneumonia what might the elder wong have said seeing that 95 investment pay off with such a distinguished career and long and happy life for his son when his daughter tries to steer him back to the interviewer question he laughs warmly again paintings exhibited throughout the united states gaining note with other asian american artists as the orientalists supplemented income by painting murals and menus with other artists for the dragon den restaurant in los angeles chinatown married legal secretary ruth kim with whom he would have three daughters pamela tom walt disney family museum walt disney studios santa monica pier bambi united states ruth kim china los angeles tyrus wong

arrived 9-year - old wong was separated from his father for a month and detained alone on angel island money was so tight that as young tyrus artistic skills began to emerge father and son sometimes could not afford ink even when he was getting trained in the western perspective at otis he was going to the l a public library and looking at books on the sung dynasty his decision to take work at disney as an in - betweener one of the artists charged with drawing the many marginally differing frames conveying movement in the early days of animation wong gorgeous eastern - inflected paintings shaped the film lush visual world wong has worked in ceramics made toys for his children and two grandchildren and since his retirement about 45 years ago fashioned the exotic kites that paint the santa monica beach sky once a month healthwise his daughter says he doing great despite hospital visits this year for an ulcer and pneumonia what might the elder wong have said seeing that 95 investment pay off with such a distinguished career and long and happy life for his son when his daughter tries to steer him back to the interviewer question he laughs warmly again paintings exhibited throughout the united states gaining note with other asian american artists as the orientalists supplemented income by painting murals and menus with other artists for the dragon den restaurant in los angeles chinatown married legal secretary ruth kim with whom he would have three daughters pamela tom walt disney family museum walt disney studios santa monica pier bambi united states ruth kim china los angeles tyrus wong

known asian american artists and at the same time one of the least known looking over footage in an editing bay in los angeles atwater village neighborhood she says in certain communities he is a living legend wong was one of the first chinese american artists to have an effect on mainstream american culture emerging in the 30s in a climate of harsh racial prejudice later when he was able to visit china his mother was gone by then but the house where he had lived had been preserved and the picture of our family was still hung on the wall detained alone as childbecause of immigration laws that worked against chinese families the just - arrived 9-year - old wong was separated from his father for a month and detained alone on angel island money was so tight that as young tyrus artistic skills began to emerge father and son sometimes could not afford ink even when he was getting trained in the western perspective at otis he was going to the l a public library and looking at books on the sung dynasty his decision to take work at disney as an in - betweener one of the artists charged with drawing the many marginally differing frames conveying movement in the early days of animation wong gorgeous eastern - inflected paintings shaped the film lush visual world wong has worked in ceramics made toys for his children and two grandchildren and since his retirement about 45 years ago fashioned the exotic kites that paint the santa monica beach sky once a month healthwise his daughter says he doing great despite hospital visits this year for an ulcer and pneumonia what might the elder wong have said seeing that 95 investment pay off with such a distinguished career and long and happy life for his son when his daughter tries to steer him back to the interviewer question he laughs warmly again paintings exhibited throughout the united states gaining note with other asian american artists as the orientalists supplemented income by painting murals and menus with other artists for the dragon den restaurant in los angeles chinatown married legal secretary ruth kim with whom he would have three daughters pamela tom walt disney family museum walt disney studios santa monica pier bambi united states ruth kim china los angeles tyrus wong
